Voice-activated Braille reader: A device that converts digital text into Braille and reads it out loud, allowing visually impaired individuals to access written content easily.
Smart cane with obstacle detection: A cane with sensors that detect obstacles and alert the user, helping them navigate safely.
Augmented reality glasses: Glasses that use augmented reality to provide visual cues and enhance the user's perception of their surroundings.
Tactile mapping system: A system that uses tactile feedback to help visually impaired individuals navigate and understand their environment.
Haptic feedback device: A device that provides tactile feedback to help visually impaired individuals understand and interact with digital content.
